articles.author: EMILY COCHRANE
articles.title: Trump Says Republican Memo ‘Totally Vindicates’ Him
articles.description: President Trump at Joint Base Andrews on Friday. Mr. Trump is accusing top officials of violating what they consider their highest duty: to fairly pursue justice.

articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: The Candidate Who’s Too Trump-Like Even for Trump
articles.description: Republicans in Washington, including President Trump, are encouraging West Virginians not to vote for Don Blankenship, a popular Senate candidate with a complicated past.

articles.author: SHARON LaFRANIERE
articles.title: Top Trump Campaign Aides Are Portrayed as Corrupt at Manafort Trial
articles.description: Rick Gates, a top campaign aide to President Trump, detailed in federal court on Tuesday a multiyear fraud by the former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort. The defense took aim at Mr. Gates’s credibility.

articles.author: MATTHEW HAAG and JACEY FORTIN
articles.title: Vanessa Trump Files for Divorce From Donald Trump Jr.
articles.description: The president’s daughter-in-law filed for an uncontested divorce in Manhattan Supreme Court on Thursday.

articles.author: KATHERINE ROSMAN and JACOB BERNSTEIN
articles.title: Unbecoming a Trump
articles.description: From left, Donald Trump, Melania Knauss, Vanessa Haydon and Donald Trump Jr. at a charity event in 2004.

articles.author: JEREMY W. PETERS
articles.title: Charles Koch Takes on Trump. Trump Takes on Charles Koch.
articles.description: Americans for Prosperity said the group would not be supporting the Republican candidate for Senate in North Dakota, Representative Kevin Cramer, who is trying to unseat a Democratic incumbent in one of the year’s most competitive races.

articles.author: CHARLES M. BLOW
articles.title: Op-Ed Columnist: ‘Sort of a Double Negative’
articles.description: President Trump at his press conference with Vladimir Putin on Monday. Mr. Trump later backpedaled on some of his remarks.

articles.author: JO BECKER, MARK MAZZETTI, MATT APUZZO and MAGGIE HABERMAN
articles.title: Mueller Zooms In on Trump Tower Cover Story
articles.description: After President Trump and the first lady, Melania Trump, left Hamburg, Germany, on July 8, he helped draft a news release that has drawn the interest of the special counsel, according to people familiar with the episode.

articles.author: PETER BAKER
articles.title: White House Memo: ‘Bigger Than Watergate’? Both Sides Say Yes, but for Different Reasons
articles.description: Forty-four years after Richard Nixon resigned, critics of President Trump see an even worse scandal. Mr. Trump says the real outrage is the investigation.

articles.author: TRIP GABRIEL
articles.title: Victories by Women Buoy Hopes of Democratic Gains in Pennsylvania
articles.description: Seeking to tap into grass-roots rejection of President Trump, Democrats want to reclaim House seats in a state Mr. Trump narrowly won in 2016

articles.author: MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MAGGIE HABERMAN
articles.title: Trump’s Lawyers Want Him to Refuse an Interview in Russia Inquiry
articles.description: John Dowd, the longtime Washington lawyer hired last summer to represent President Trump in the Russia investigation, wants Mr. Trump to rebuff an interview request from the special counsel.

articles.author: EMILY BAUMGAERTNER
articles.title: Here’s Who Will Sit With the First Lady at the State of the Union
articles.description: President Trump and Melania Trump, the first lady, have released their joint guest list for the State of the Union address on Tuesday night.

articles.author: KATIE ROGERS
articles.title: Melania Trump’s Task in Europe? Show Another Side of the White House
articles.description: The first lady, Melania Trump, will accompany her husband on a trip to Europe, a high-profile re-entry into the spotlight for Mrs. Trump.

articles.author: MARK MAZZETTI
articles.title: How Trump Allies Shifted Their Defense as Evidence of Contacts With Russians Grew
articles.description: Rudolph W. Giuliani, a lawyer for President Trump, said in interviews on Monday that even if President Trump colluded with the Russians, he committed no crime.

articles.author: CHARLES M. BLOW
articles.title: Trump, Treasonous Traitor
articles.description: President Donald Trump meets with President Vladimir Putin of Russia at the G-20 Summit, in Hamburg, Germany, in July 2017.

articles.author: THE EDITORIAL BOARD
articles.title: North Korea, Trump-Style
articles.description: The meeting was classic Trump: enormous hype, ulcer-inducing suspense, oceans of self-congratulation, ending with grandiose, fuzzy promises.

articles.author: MICHAEL D. SHEAR
articles.title: Trump Reimbursed Lawyer for Hush Money Paid to Stormy Daniels, Giuliani Says
articles.description: President Trump in April on Air Force One, where he was asked specifically whether he knew about the payment to a pornographic film actress, Stephanie Clifford. Mr. Trump said “no” and referred questions to his personal lawyer.

articles.author: U.S. STATE DEPARTMENT
articles.title: Trump Announces Airstrikes Against Syria
articles.description: In an address from the White House, President Trump said the United States and European allies sought to punish Syria’s president for a suspected chemical attack.

articles.author: NIRAJ CHOKSHI
articles.title: Trump Voters Driven by Fear of Losing Status, Not Economic Anxiety, Study Finds
articles.description: A Trump supporter at a campaign rally in Sacramento in June 2016. A new study found that many Trump voters were driven by fear of losing their status in society.

articles.author: CHRIS STANFORD
articles.title: Ronny Jackson, Debbie Lesko, Finland: Your Wednesday Briefing
articles.description: President Trump and the first lady, Melania Trump, welcomed President Emmanuel Macron of France and his wife, Brigitte Macron, to the White House for a state dinner on Tuesday.
